koide_derivation.origin: Z_3 cyclic symmetry of J_3(O) diagonal positions

why_sqrt_2.geometric_origin: Ratio of off-diagonal to diagonal J_3(O_C) structure

mass_predictions.significance: Koide is a genuine constraint, not numerology

quark_extension.interpretation: CKM mixing smears Z_3 structure for quarks

Q529.question: Can Koide-like relations be derived for quarks?

Q529.implication: Would unify all fermion mass predictions

Q530.question: What determines the Koide angle theta?
Q530.description: theta ~ 0.222 rad determines the specific mass ratios
Q530.implication: Would predict absolute masses, not just ratios

Q531.question: Is there a Koide relation for neutrinos?
Q531.description: Neutrino masses have large PMNS mixing

Q532.description: Small deviation may come from radiative corrections

Q533.description: theta involves the Koide angle - is it algebraic?
Q533.implication: Would derive ALL charged lepton masses from algebra

Q534.question: Is there a generalized Koide for all 9 fermion masses?

summary.main_result: Q = 2/3 from Z_3 symmetry of J_3(O) diagonal positions
